module:
AMQP data encoding and decoding. For typical Proton-based applications, these classes will not be used directly.
AMQP definition https://docs.oasis-open.org/amqp/core/v1.0/os/amqp-core-types-v1.0-os.html#type-{} _gen_amqp_type_link
An empty value. A true or false value. A single Unicode character. A sequence of Unicode characters. A sequence of bytes. A 32-bit floating point number. A 64-bit floating point number. A signed 8-bit integer. A signed 16-bit integer. A signed 32-bit integer. A signed 64-bit integer. An unsigned 8-bit integer. An unsigned 16-bit integer. An unsigned 32-bit integer. An unsigned 64-bit integer.
A sequence of values of a single type. A sequence of values of variable type. A mapping from distinct keys to values.
A symbolic value from a constrained domain. An absolute point in time. A universally unique identifier.
Decimal floating point
A 32-bit decimal floating point number. A 64-bit decimal floating point number. A 128-bit decimal floating point number.
